colorLib
Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
  colorLib.Palette
      colorLib.Gradient

public class Gradient
extends Palette

Create a Palette object with all colors of a gradient. This class extends the Palette class, so all the methods of the Palette class can be accessed from here.

Author:
Andreas Köberle, Jan Vantomme

Constructor Summary
Gradient(Palette i_palette, int i_step)
          Creates a gradient with the colors of the passed Palette object and the specified number of steps.
Gradient(Palette i_palette, int i_size, boolean i_wrap)
           
Gradient(processing.core.PApplet i_p, int[] i_colors, int i_size)
          Creates a Gradient object which holds all colors to create a gradient.
Gradient(processing.core.PApplet i_p, int[] i_colors, int i_size, boolean i_wrap)
          Creates a gradient with the passed colors array and the specified number of steps.

Constructor Detail

Gradient

public Gradient(processing.core.PApplet i_p,
                int[] i_colors,
                int i_size)
Creates a Gradient object which holds all colors to create a gradient.

Parameters:
i_p - PApplet, normally you will use 'this'.
i_colors - int[], an int array which holds the colors in the processing way
i_size - int, the size of the gradient

Gradient

public Gradient(Palette i_palette,
                int i_step)
Creates a gradient with the colors of the passed Palette object and the specified number of steps.

Parameters:
i_palette - Palette, a Palette object
i_step - int, the number of steps

Gradient

public Gradient(processing.core.PApplet i_p,
                int[] i_colors,
                int i_size,
                boolean i_wrap)
Creates a gradient with the passed colors array and the specified number of steps.

Parameters:
i_colors - an array of colors.
i_wrap - boolean, if its true the gradient ends with the same colors as its begin (default is false)

Gradient

public Gradient(Palette i_palette,
                int i_size,
                boolean i_wrap)
